definition: to get along well/compatible/also written 和得來|和得来[he2 de5 lai2]
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
variant of 合[he2]
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: Tom is an easygoing type of person who gets along well with everyone.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆是那种随和的人，跟谁都合得来。
我和我的搭档很合得来。

sentences.english: His girlfriend is hunky-dory, getting on nicely with almost everyone.
sentences.chinese: 他的女朋友挺不错的，跟谁都合得来。

sentences.english: I think you two are gonna like each other.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得你们俩会合得来的。

sentences.english: We hit it off right from the start.
sentences.chinese: 我们从一开始就合得来。

sentences.english: Most of all, I am looking for someone who is compatible and share similar values.
sentences.chinese: 最重要的是我们要合得来，有相似的价值观。

sentences.english: I think we two really click。
sentences.chinese: 我觉得我们两个蛮合得来的。

sentences.english: We've hit it off ever since we knew each other.
sentences.chinese: 我们从刚认识就很合得来。

sentences.english: I am compatible with my partner.
sentences.chinese: 我和我的搭档很合得来。

sentences.english: Ex. Sue has so strong personality that few people can stand her.
sentences.chinese: 苏的个性太强悍以至于很少有人能和她合得来。

sentences.english: Junko and I hit it off from the start.
sentences.chinese: 纯子和我从一开始就合得来。

sentences.english: His girlfriend is hunky-dory, getting on nicely ost everyone.
sentences.chinese: 他的女朋友挺不错的，跟谁都合得来。

definition: to be able to talk to/to get along with/to be congenial
unable to get along together/incompatible
to be kindred spirits/to hit it off
agreeing with one another/congenial
to have an affinity with each other (idiom)/to find each other congenial
to be well matched/to suit
in time with (i.e. same rhythm)/to keep in step with/fig. to cooperate
to be in contact (with sb)/to associate/to interact/to get along (well, poorly)
to share vile habits/partners in notoriety/birds of a feather
to make friends/(dialect) to start an affair with sb
to be dating sb
familiarity breeds fondness (idiom)
nature/disposition/temperament/character/CL:個|个[ge4]
incompatibility of temperament
entertaining in conversation
the families are well-matched in terms of social status (idiom)/(of a prospective marriage partner) an appropriate match
